snippet: The change of plans undercut President Obama’s “pivot” to Asia, and this week China’s leader, Xi Jinping, seized the opening in some of the nations Mr. Obama would have visited.
abstract: China's Pres Xi Jinping completes visit to several Asian countries after Pres Obama cancels trip to region because of government shutdown and threat of default; seizes opportunity to capitalize on Obama's absence to gain edge over United States in regional influence.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Choe Sang-hun in Seoul, Joe Cochrane in Jakarta, Martin Fackler in Tokyo and Floyd Whaley in the Philippines.

lead_paragraph: The change of plans undercut President Obama’s “pivot” to Asia, and this week China’s leader, Xi Jinping, seized the opening in some of the nations Mr. Obama would have visited.

headline.main: Cancellation of Trip by Obama Plays to Doubts of Asia Allies
headline.print_headline: China Seizes Opening in U.S. Absence

keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
keywords.name: glocations
